Based on the database of the Ministry of Culture a settlement sample was created in which all counties were represented, excluding Zala county. At the sample selection for the sake of national representativity, the applying school maintaining local governments were ranked on the basis of the number of teachers receiving severance pay, and those 31 school maintaining local self-governments were selected which made redundant the highest number of teachers (altogether 1423 persons) with severance pay. During the data collection all of the schools were sent a postal data sheet. A total of 856 school directors receved a data sheet, and out of them 282 (33%) replied. From the schools lead by these directors the researchers selected 210 teachers who were made to retire or made redundant during the school reorganizations.
